(S. Korea);   M.A. Univ. of Iowa;   Ph.D. Univ. of Iowa. Biography JungBong Choi teaches theories of cultural globalization, transnational media, and the political economy of digital technologies as well as Korean and Japanese cinema. He authored Digitalization of Television in Japan: State, Economy, and Discourse (2008) and edited Of Transnational-Korean Cinematrix (2012) for Transnational Cinemas, Unsettling the National in Korean Cinema for the Journal of Korean Studies (2011), and G lobalization, Television and Japan (co-edited, 2010). He is currently working on two books titled Trans-ing the National: Theory of Transnational Culture & Media and K pop Politics: Digital Mediation and Global Fandom .
